title: Evacuation from besieged Mariupol steel plant underway
description: The evacuation of civilians from the besieged Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol is underway, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky announced Sunday.

title: Pelosi calls Ukraine's resistance against Russia a 'fight for everyone' in unannounced trip to Kyiv
description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi made an unannounced trip to the Ukrainian capital on Saturday, becoming the most senior United States official to meet with President Volodymr Zelensky since the war broke out more than two months ago.

title: Russians plunder $5M farm vehicles from Ukraine -- to find they've been remotely disabled
description: Russian troops in the occupied city of Melitopol have stolen all the equipment from a farm equipment dealership -- and shipped it to Chechnya, according to a Ukrainian businessman in the area.

title: Has inflation reached a peak? Three signs that prices could soon come down
description: Inflation is at a 40-year high, and Americans are feeling it.

title: Arkansas GOP governor says he's considering 2024 bid and would run even if Trump does
description: Republican Gov. Asa Hutchinson of Arkansas said Sunday that he's weighing a White House bid in 2024 and that he would still consider running even if former President Donald Trump enters the race.

title: 'Tattooed on my rear end!': Cruz mocks GOP candidates invoking Trump
description: Sen. Ted Cruz (R-TX) pokes fun at candidates using their devotion to Trump as a platform in the Ohio Republican Senate nomination. CNN's Abby Phillip hosts a panel discussing the race that will act as an early test of Trump's influence over the GOP in this year's midterm elections.

title: Mayorkas responds to new disinformation board being compared to '1984'
description: Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas discusses the newly announced disinformation governance board with CNN's Dana Bash.

title: 'She's my guardian angel': DoorDasher saves woman's life while delivering pizza
description: When a Massachusetts woman ordered a pizza on a routine Friday evening, she had no idea the quick thinking and kindness of her delivery driver would change her life that night.

title: At least 1 dead and five injured after gunfire breaks out at a Jackson, Mississippi, festival
description: One person was dead and five others were hurt after gunfire erupted at a festival in Jackson, Mississippi, Saturday night, police said.

title: In 1968, Poland's communist government forced Jews to leave. Today, the country embraces refugees.
description: Because SS soldiers used the Nożyk Synagogue as a warehouse and horse stable during World War II, it was the only major Jewish synagogue the Nazis did not destroy in Poland's capital city of Warsaw.

title: Johnny Depp's defamation trial: Here's a look at what took place last week
description: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's defamation trial concluded its third week in a Virginia court on Friday.

title: The most iconic moments from the White House Correspondents' Dinner
description: Remember Obama's infamous mic drop? Catch that and more stand-out moments from previous White House Correspondents' Dinners.

title: Baby bald eagle rescued after parent accidentally kicks it from nest
description: Ecologists came to the rescue of a baby bald eagle after it was accidentally kicked from its nest by its parent.

title: Buffett says Berkshire's success is more about being 'sane' than 'smart'
description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has beaten the broader market so far this year. But the Oracle of Omaha wasn't willing to declare himself an investing genius during Saturday's annual shareholder meeting.

title: No one knew who James Corden was. Then he made 'The Late Late Show' a huge success
description: Every time a host leaves an established late-night show, the guessing game begins:

title: The new 'Star Trek' series couldn't come at a better time
description: Rod Roddenberry Jr. is the only son of "Star Trek's" iconic creator, but he never watched the show growing up. He was more into cars, heavy metal music and watching action television shows like "Starsky & Hutch" and "Knight Rider."

title: Pelosi to Zelensky: US will 'be there for you until the fight is done'
description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi led the first official US congressional Delegation to visit Ukraine since the start of the war. She is also the most senior United States official to meet with the Ukrainian President since the start of the Russian invasion. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

title: The 3 things that need to happen for Democrats to keep the Senate
description: Election junkies, rejoice. May marks the return of the 2022 primary season and the beginning of a mostly nonstop electoral stretch, from the midterms through the 2024 presidential cycle.

title: See Nike's new building honoring tennis star Serena Williams
description: Nike has only a few buildings named after female athletes. Serena Williams just got hers. Check out Nike's 1-million-square-foot building crafted for its design, insights and product-merchandising teams.

title: Boxer Katie Taylor makes history at Madison Square Garden
description: Ireland's Katie Taylor defeated Puerto Rico's Amanda Serrano Saturday night in the first boxing match headlined by two women at New York's Madison Square Garden.

title: How to avoid toe jam, that icky buildup between your toes
description: Toe jam can be a source of fascination, disgust or barely noticed. It can be a sign you need to wash your feet or rethink your choice of footwear. It can also lead to major health issues.

title: How Jay-Z inspired this Real Housewife's new bourbon
description: For fans of "The Real Housewives of New York City," Bluestone Manor was more than home — it was essentially a bonus cast member.

title: 'We need to quit tip-toeing around the word abortion'
description: Meg Schurr was 22 years old when she says she was sexually assaulted. ​

title: Melissa Lucio was sentenced to death. Courts will now look at these 4 claims to decide if she gets a new trial
description: Fourteen years after she was sent to Texas' death row, Melissa's Lucio will finally get the chance to have new evidence of her innocence claims examined in state court.

title: These young Muslim Americans hit significant turning points in their lives this Ramadan
description: Six months after Mussab Ali started his first year of Harvard Law School, he was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer and underwent chemotherapy during Ramadan.

title: A Maryland man won $100,000 after skipping work
description: A Maryland man skipped work -- but still got paid, thanks to a winning $100,000 lottery ticket he bought on his day off.

title: China issues major escalation of Covid restrictions as five-day holiday gets underway
LongHorn Steakhouse honors employee who grilled 1 million steaks
description: There's a new grill master in town, just in time for grilling season.

title: The show must go on: Defiant dancers return to the stage as war rages in Ukraine
description: With the audience waiting eagerly in its seats, a familiar message echoes through the hall, reminding patrons to turn off phones and immerse themselves in the experience.

title: Mummified bird could unlock new ways to experience museum exhibits
description: It all started with a report of two mummies in a university closet.

title: 'Heart-wrenching': Orlando Bloom discusses meeting with Ukrainian refugees
description: Actor and UNICEF Goodwill ambassador Orlando Bloom speaks to CNN's Jim Acosta about meeting with Ukrainian refugees who have fled to Moldova.

title: The University of Georgia has broken an NFL record with 15 players drafted
description: The University of Georgia Bulldogs saw 15 of its players drafted this week, breaking an all-time NFL record for most players selected from a single college team in a seven-round draft.
